<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 13"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Spell Devourer](/Feats.aspx?ID=1293) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Orc" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=124" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 19 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The temporary Hit Points granted by the Spell Devourer orc ancestry feat are applied as soon as the character succeeds at their saving throw; for an effect that causes Hit Point damage on a successful save, such as a fireball, this means that the character gains the temporary Hit Points before taking damage._

**Prerequisites**
[Pervasive Superstition](/Feats.aspx?ID=89)

</column>

---

You don't just resist magic; you devour it. Whenever you succeed at a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to double the spell's level, or equal to the level if the magical effect isn't a spell. These temporary Hit Points last until the end of your next turn.
name: Spell Devourer
